ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:
Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

narratives.question_text:
What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I learned a good amount of basic German that I feel confident has left me at a good place to continue with my self-study or another German course in the future.
Basic but helpful vocabulary and grammar for German. Conversation, reading comprehension and listening comprehension skills. General cultural information.
Professor Naqvi taught me the basic building blocks of German and I'm excited to continue my studies in the language next year
German grammar, speaking, words and culture
This course provides an introduction to the German speaking, listening, reading, and writing.

narratives.question_text:
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments:
Strengths: The syllabus for the course was really great and the small seminar format definitely facilitated my learning. 
Weaknesses: The online textbook that we used was a bit pricey and the homework at times felt a little bit like busywork (matching exercises, crosswords, drag and drop fill in the blank exercises) rather than testing our comprehension of the material.
Languages are very difficult over Zoom - especially beginning one, but despite that Prof. Naqvi did an incredible job of keeping us engaged and up to speed with the material.

Strengths - The instructor is a native speaker. Supportive and informative.
Weaknesses - sometimes too many materials to learn in a short period of time. But it's understandable because learning a new language takes a lot of concentration and effort.

The virtual nature of the course was a drawback, but there was no alternative. If possible, it would have been better to have synchronous class all five days of the week, especially at such a low level. The asynchronous days boosted our existing learning, but didn't really move our progress along.

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I liked the balance of live classes and asynchronous self study. The length of the classes was just right, and so was the amount of work. The only thing I would change would be Nicos Weg - I liked the program, but sometimes I wish there were more variety.
Succeeded - I felt comfortable to talk and participate in class on zoom. A small number of people definitely helped.

narratives.question_text:
Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
(Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Absolutely! Prof Naqvi is so welcoming and makes German feel accessible to complete beginners. Take this class!!
I would most certainly recommend to anyone thinking of beginning German

Yes, I would definitely recommend this course. As a music major, I always wanted to learn German and this course really helped me and made me want to go to German speaking countries to study in the future.

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.
comments: Asynchronous self study with prerecorded lectures and assignments on Tuesdays and Thursdays
Outside assignments completed virtually with classmates
Three days of live virtual classes + two days of asynchoronous assignments
We were synchronous three times a week (Monday, Wednesday, Friday) and asynchronous twice a week (Tuesday, Thursday).
